intro: Schizomeria ovata, commonly known as the ovalleaf schizomeria, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers and gourds, though it is not closely related to them. The plant is characterized by its simple, ovate leaves and small, yellowish flowers that appear in clusters. Its fruits are small, round, and covered in a rough, hairy texture. Schizomeria ovata is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
